page.title: 19WOODINGDEAN'S BEAT POLICEMAN
page.content: The local beat policeman for Woodingdean has lived in Woodingdean for eight years and has been on the beat for over three years.He walks about five miles per day dealing with burglaries,vandalism and just talking to people. He does not have a set route. Most of the time he spends in Woodingdean but he also looks after Ovingdean and the grassland area Westwards.In his time our policeman thinks that Woodingdean has changed for the better. He feels that the beat policeman is able to prevent a lot of crime just by walking around. Over the years he has noticed Woodingdean become a dormitory village with people commuting out of the area to work.He states that there is no such thing as an average day for a policeman.
